title: Transient bug. Error asked I submit as bug.
body:
Doing a cross compile build of several included KubOS service and got an error while building one.
entered:
`cargo build -p telemetry-service --target arm-unknown-linux-gnueabihf --release` 
as part of a script that runs the build for 11 crates.
stdout:
```sh
   Compiling syn v1.0.7
   Compiling libsqlite3-sys v0.16.0
   Compiling filetime v0.2.7
   Compiling xattr v0.2.2
   Compiling tar v0.4.26
   Compiling synstructure v0.12.1
   Compiling serde_derive v1.0.102
   Compiling failure_derive v0.1.6
   Compiling diesel_derives v1.4.1
   Compiling failure v0.1.6
   Compiling serde v1.0.102
   Compiling diesel v1.4.3
   Compiling log v0.4.8
   Compiling indexmap v1.3.0
   Compiling serde_json v1.0.41
   Compiling serde-value v0.5.3
   Compiling serde_yaml v0.8.11
   Compiling serde_urlencoded v0.6.1
   Compiling toml v0.4.10
   Compiling tokio-io v0.1.12
   Compiling mio v0.6.19
   Compiling log v0.3.9
   Compiling tokio-threadpool v0.1.16
   Compiling want v0.2.0
   Compiling tungstenite v0.9.1
   Compiling juniper v0.11.1
   Compiling mime v0.2.6
   Compiling tokio-codec v0.1.1
   Compiling h2 v0.1.26
   Compiling tokio-reactor v0.1.10
   Compiling mio-uds v0.6.7
   Compiling tokio-fs v0.1.6
   Compiling log4rs v0.8.3
   Compiling mime_guess v1.8.7
   Compiling tokio-tcp v0.1.3
   Compiling tokio-uds v0.2.5
   Compiling tokio-udp v0.1.5
   Compiling multipart v0.16.1
   Compiling tokio v0.1.22
   Compiling log4rs-syslog v3.0.3
   Compiling hyper v0.12.35
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: Os { code: 20, kind: Other, message: "Not a directory" }', src/libcore/result.rs:1165:5
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace.

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.39.0 (4560ea788 2019-11-04) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

note: compiler flags: -C opt-level=z -C panic=abort -C codegen-units=1 -C linker=/usr/bin/bbb_toolchain/usr/bin/arm-linux-gcc --crate-type lib

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden

error: could not compile `log4rs-syslog`.
warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish...
error: build failed
```
Ran the build again and it compiled fine. Did a cargo clean and then built again. Still fine.
### Meta
Using the latest stable version

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.39.0 (4560ea788 2019-11-04)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 4560ea788cb760f0a34127156c78e2552949f734
commit-date: 2019-11-04
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.39.0
LLVM version: 9.0
```

### Backtrace
Ran again with RUST_BACKTRACE=1 set to get the backtrace and it completed successfully; no error. So good for me, bad for bug reporting.
Ran cargo clean and the build command again, but it was successful again.
